com.samskivert.depot

Class Funcs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.depot.Funcs

  • public class Funcs
extends Object
    Provides static methods for function construction.

    • Method Detail

      • average

        public static FluentExp<Number> average(SQLExpression<? extends Number> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that averages all values from the supplied expression. Note that this method forces the result to type Number because databases may perform widening under the hood, and using Number allows the application to do the appropriate conversion at runtime.

      • averageDistinct

        public static FluentExp<Number> averageDistinct(SQLExpression<? extends Number> expr)
        Creates an expression that averages all distinct values from the supplied expression. Note that this method forces the result to type Number because databases may perform widening under the hood, and using Number allows the application to do the appropriate conversion at runtime.

      • countStar

        public static FluentExp<Number> countStar()
        Creates an aggregate expression that counts the number of rows that match the other clauses in this query.

      • count

        public static FluentExp<Number> count(SQLExpression<?> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that counts the number of rows from the supplied expression. This would usually be used in a FieldOverride and supplied with a ColumnExp.

      • countDistinct

        public static FluentExp<Number> countDistinct(SQLExpression<?> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that counts the number of distinct values from the supplied expression. This would usually be used in a FieldOverride and supplied with a ColumnExp.

      • every

        public static FluentExp<Boolean> every(SQLExpression<?> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that evaluates to true iff every value from the supplied expression is also true. This would usually be used in a FieldOverride and supplied with a ColumnExp.

      • max

        public static <T extends Number> FluentExp<T> max(SQLExpression<T> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that finds the largest value in the values from the supplied expression. This would usually be used in a FieldOverride and supplied with a ColumnExp.

      • min

        public static <T extends Number> FluentExp<T> min(SQLExpression<T> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that finds the largest value in the values from the supplied expression. This would usually be used in a FieldOverride and supplied with a ColumnExp.

      • sum

        public static FluentExp<Number> sum(SQLExpression<? extends Number> expr)
        Creates an aggregate expression that sums all the values from the supplied expression. Note that this method forces the result to type Number because databases may perform widening under the hood, and using Number allows the application to do the appropriate conversion at runtime.

      • coalesce

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> coalesce(SQLExpression<? extends T> arg1,
                                        SQLExpression<? extends T> arg2)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the first supplied expression that is not null.

      • coalesce

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> coalesce(SQLExpression<? extends T>... args)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the first supplied expression that is not null.

      • greatest

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> greatest(SQLExpression<? extends T> arg1,
                                        SQLExpression<? extends T> arg2)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the largest of the given expressions.

      • greatest

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> greatest(SQLExpression<? extends T>... args)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the largest of the given expressions.

      • least

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> least(SQLExpression<? extends T> arg1,
                                     SQLExpression<? extends T> arg2)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the smallest of the given expressions.

      • least

        public static <T> FluentExp<T> least(SQLExpression<? extends T>... args)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the smallest of the given expressions.

      • arrayLength

        public static FluentExp<Number> arrayLength(SQLExpression<?> exp)
        Creates an expression that evaluates to the length of the supplied array column.
